intro: Silene hirticalyx, commonly known as the hairy-fruited catchfly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in meadows and rocky soils. The plant features pink to purple flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are covered in fine, hairy textures. Silene hirticalyx is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
